name: Handsel Monday

attributes.attribute: day for Divination or forecasting futures through games of chance and trial
this day was the first in a sequence of 12 days whose weather predicted that of the following 12 months
the gift offered to every visitor on this day

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Scottish tradition holds a festival called Hansel Monday (Di-luian an t-sainnseil). This event takes place on the first Monday following Hogmany (New Year’s Day) and involves fortune-telling through games of chance and trial. On the Isle of Skye, the weather of this day is believed to predict that of the following 12 months, marking the first of a 12-day sequence. The holiday is derived from the Scottish sainnseal, or gift given to every visitor on this occasion. The name has anglicized over time.
